title: honestly it pisses me off to see azir in pro play.
body: I mean what can I say. this isn't about me playing against him but just god damn it is it lame to watch a team helplessly try to do anything against a really good azir. I mean lord engage/disengage sustained and burst magic damage. its so ridiculous it just really pisses me off to see even azir counters lose to him in and out of lane. I mean what is he supposed to be both a lane bully and a late game hypercarry i dont get it. ignore the winrate and the nerfs but why does he gotta be good at everything. I mean his Q cooldown is too damn low. multiple usages during the same solider duration. its stupid. its like man can it stop. oh he does that and that and that and it doesn't stop. put a limit on what azir can do ffs. he can do everything better than almost everyone that specializes at one of the many powers azir has

Late reply, but I do have trouble against him as Morgana.  I'm generally fine as Xerath, and ok with Vel'koz; however, you seem to be forgetting that the Azir player picks after I do 1/2 the time.

Sure, Morgana can still cs against him well enough, but it's not like his pushing ability is worse than hers.  He also outscales her unless my adc is actually good enough that a Black Shield is appropriately useful.

Even then, Azir is such a god in the late game, and doesn't suffer for it at any point in the game.  In the super early laning phase, he can easily push the lane with his soldiers from a decent range, keeping him from being killed at the very least.  After the first couple levels, he gains massive harass, an easy escape, and a somewhat easy gank tool at 6.

You don't have to be a pro to W->auto->Q->auto for a thunderlord's proc with Azir.  You could argue that I could retaliate with an all in during that, but I'll probably take at least one extra auto for my trouble.  If I use my mobility to go in on him, the enemy jungler could easily show up to kill me as well.  It's just a difficult situation where all answers seem wrong.

This is not to say that I always lose to Azir (I really don't know my win-rate against him, so I could even be >50%), but he is a frustrating champion to go against with his general strength throughout the game.

The main issue is Azirs true hard counters are either unviable professionally, or don't work because it's too risky to go in because there's piss all vision.
You have to remember that in pro play, the possibility of a gank is normally a stifle against any aggression. This creates what I like to call Schrodinger's Jungler, wherein the Jungler is there until he isn't (if you don't know where he is, assume he is in that brush to the left).
Stuff like talon doesn't work because it's gimmicky, unviable, and easy to counter at the pro level, and stuff like Vel Koz and Xerath are double edged swords that really only turn mid into a "my jungler babysat me more so I win".

The fault is all on riot for trying to force pro players to take more risks when they make plays SPECIFICALLY BASED ON WHAT IS THE LEAST RISKY. It opened the way for 24/7 lane swapping, and stale champion diversity/matchups, with about 1 or 2 S tier picks in each lane at any one time, and the rest hovering between usable and trash.
Yes, Nerf chicken-man

The real trouble with Azir is that he has to be double-balanced between his professional play dominance cases and his solo queue under-performance.  Any stat nerf will just make him even less playable in solo queue, while not addressing the mechanics that make him so strong in pro play.
